Class: Signal

Signal()

new Signal()

Properties:
Name Type Description
deviceClass RFDevice

The RFDevice deviceclass to which this Signal instance is bound
signalType String

The type of signal this signal instance is for. Can be '433'|'868'|'ir'.
signal Homey.Signal

A Homey.Signal instance corresponding to this signal
signalKey String

The id of the signal as defined in app.json
signalId String

A Unique id for the signal
signalConfig Object

The manifest entry of the signal
options Object

The options of the signal as configured in the 'rf' property of the signal
Fires:
  • Signal#event:cmd
  • Signal#event:payload
  • Signal#event:data
  • Signal#event:payload_send
  • Signal#event:cmd_send
  • Signal#event:error

Methods

manualDebounce(timeout, allListenersopt)

Function that can be called to drop all incoming packets for a given period of time

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
timeout Number

How long incoming packets should be dropped
allListeners Boolean <optional>

If packets should be dropped for all listeners on this Homey signal or only this instance that uses the Homey signal instance.

register(key) → {Promise}

Registers this signal at Homey for given key. The signal is only unregistered at Homey if unregister is called for all keys.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
key *

A key that is unique
Returns:

result A promise that resolves when the signal is registered at Homey.

Type
Promise

send(payload, optionsopt) → {Promise}

Sends a payload array

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
payload Array.<Number>

The payload array to send
options Object <optional>

The transmission options for sending the payload

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
repetitions Number <optional>

A custom amount of repetitions
Returns:

result A promise that resolves when the payload is send.

Type
Promise

sendCmd(cmd) → {Promise}

Sends a command

Parameters:
Name Type Description
cmd String

The command to send
Returns:

result A promise that resolves when the command is send.

Type
Promise

tx(payload, callback)

Directly call the tx method of signal without checking if the signal is registered. Usage of this function is not recommended!

Parameters:
Name Type Description
payload Array.<Number>

The payload array
callback function

The callback function that is called by Homey.Signal.tx

unregister(key)

Unregisters this signal key. The signal is only unregistered at Homey if this function is called for all registered keys.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
key *

The unique key that is used to call Signal#register

Events

cmd

Fired when a new cmd is received

Properties:
Name Type Description
cmd String

The key of the cmd received

cmd_send

Fired when a cmd is send

Properties:
Name Type Description
cmd String

The command that was send

data

Fired when a new data object is received and parsed by this.deviceClass.payloadToData (after Signal#event:payload fired)

Properties:
Name Type Description
data Object

The data object received
payload Array.<Number>

The payload received

error

Fired when a error occured

Properties:
Name Type Description
err Error

The error that occurred

payload

Fired when a new payload is received

Properties:
Name Type Description
payload Array.<Number>

The payload that was received

payload_send

Fired when a payload is send

Properties:
Name Type Description
payload Array.<Number>

The payload that was send
